subject: Leadership
title: Strategy vs. Tactics
description: A quick, practical guide to Strategy vs. Tactics.

hook.text: A chess player focuses on capturing pieces but loses. The opponent sacrificed pieces but controlled the board.

buildup.text: Tactics are specific actions taken now. Strategy is the overarching plan that gives those actions direction and purpose.

discovery.text: Sun Tzu: 'Strategy without tactics is the slowest route to victory. Tactics without strategy is noise before defeat.'

twist.text: Many organizations have excellent tactics but no strategy. They execute brilliantlyâ€”in the wrong direction entirely.

climax.text: Leaders must hold both: set the strategic direction, then empower teams to find the best tactical path to get there.

quiz.question: What is the relationship between strategy and tactics?
options: Strategy gives direction; tactics are specific actions
Tactics are more important than strategy
